channel.title: Reviews on Trek Relaunch Book Club
channel.description: Recent content in Reviews on Trek Relaunch Book Club

item.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Death In Winter book review (1)
item.description:
DNA thieves, Beverly Crusher’s maiden name and a few guest appearances from the USS Stargazer. Can author Michael Jan Friedman maneuver the Star Trek TNG books into this new era?

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: Titan: Taking Wing book review (2)
item.description:
Riker finally gets that 4th pip and has left The Enterprise to captain The Titan. Can this book of new diverse characters find its feet and deliver a compelling read?

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: Titan: The Red King book review (3)
item.description:
Star Trek Titan finally hits warp speed in this direct follow-up to book #1 Taking Wing. Launched into the far reaches of a satellite galaxy, can Riker steer his crew back to safety?

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: Articles Of The Federation (4)
item.description:
Join your favourite Federation political characters Jed Bartlet, CJ Cregg, Josh Lymen and grumpy old Toby Ziegler as they navigate the pitfalls and challenges of running a massive multi-planetary political juggernaut. Oh waitâ€¦ is this The West Wing or Star Trek?

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: Titan: Orions Hounds book review (5)
item.description:
Now that the Dominion War is over, Starfleet is finally getting back to good old exploration. Will Riker and his team of diverse Starfleet personnel must face a set of space whalers who have set their long harpoons on the poor old Space Jellies from TNG season 1 episode 1.

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Resistance book review (6)
item.description:
The Borg are back. But this time they are faster, meaner and more adaptable. Will their new queen ascend to the throne and doom Earth to assimilation?

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Q&A Book Review (7)
item.description:
When Q comes on the TV, I groan and think oh great this one is a Q episode… Can Keith R.A. DeCandido do the near-impossible and write a decent Q novel?

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Before Dishonor book review (8)
item.description:
The Borg are back… again. And they’re hungry. They’re eating starships. They’re eating planets. They’re back for revenge, and now only Seven of Nine can stop them… with a little help from her friends.

Spoilers ahead!

item.title: Star Trek: Titan: Sword of Damocles book review (9)
item.description: I am currently reading this book. The review will be posted soon!
